bee697f2236042a2aaa5e08536c37b37:
10 Egyptian soldiers were killed by roadside bombs during clashes with Islamist extremists in Sinai.
The soldiers died following a raid on an "extremely dangerous" militant hideout.
15 extremists were killed and seven others taken prisoner during the raid.
The army destroyed half a ton of TNT explosive and seized other weapons and equipment during the raid.
Egyptian security forces have for years been battling a rebellion waged mainly by militants from an "Islamic State" (IS) affiliate in northern Sinai.
Hundreds of soldiers and policemen have been killed since the insurgency erupted in 2013.
74a49ed03b508e0ae4a8afdfc672707f:
Three military officers and seven soldiers have been killed by a blast while the military raids killed 15 militants and arrested seven others in Egypt's Central Sinai area of North Sinai province.
Two explosive devices blew up in two armored vehicles of the raiding forces which left three officers and seven personnel of the armed forces dead.
The raids destroyed two warehouses containing large amounts of ammunition and explosives and seized two vehicles carrying several bombs and hundreds of cell phones and laptops belonging to the terrorists.
Since the beginning of March, security campaigns in North Sinai have killed at least 45 militants, arrested about 180 suspects over terror-related charges, busted hundreds of other suspects over different charges, including smuggling and illegal migration, ruined several smuggling tunnels, detonated dozens of explosive devices and seized large amounts of weapons and ammunition.
Anti-government terror attacks in Egypt have killed hundreds of policemen and soldiers since the mid-2013 military removal of former Islamist President Mohamed Morsi.
Most of the terrorist attacks nationwide, particularly those in North Sinai province bordering Israel and the Palestinian Gaza Strip, have been claimed by a Sinai-based group loyal to the Islamic State regional terrorist group.
Security campaigns in Sinai have killed hundreds of militants and arrested a similar number of suspects over the past few years as part of the country's anti-terror war declared by former army chief and current President Abdel-Fattah al-Sisi following Morsi's removal.
Egypt's military intelligence chief, Gen. Mohamed Farag al-Shahhat, said during a military-held symposium in February that at least 500 terrorists have been killed since a massive anti-terror campaign, known as "The Martyr's Right," started in September 2015.
a8147d962ba83768858af4c2cd402e9a:
Ten Egyptian security forces have been killed during an anti-terror operation in central Sinai after their vehicles were targeted by bombs.
Security forces killed 15 people and arrested seven others in the course of the operation on a militant base in the peninsula.
Security forces found and destroyed half a ton of TNT explosive, and seized two vehicles containing hand grenades and hundreds of mobile phones.
The Sinai Peninsula has been under a state of emergency since October 2014, following a deadly attack that left 33 Egyptian soldiers dead.
Daesh-affiliated militants have claimed responsibility for most of the assaults, mainly targeting the army and police.
abfdf907587c5275a3cdc90894313d2a:
Khalid Masood, a 52-year-old British man, was inspired by Islamist ideology and carried out a terror attack outside the U.K. Parliament, killing three people and injuring 40.
ISIS claimed responsibility for the attack, which involved Masood ramming his car into crowds of people on Westminster Bridge and then fatally stabbing a police officer.
A day later, 10 security personnel, including three army officers, were killed in two roadside bombings in the Sinai peninsula, Egypt.
Soldiers fought back, killing at least 15 fighters linked to ISIS and arresting seven others.
ISIS released a video in February where fighters threatened to kill Christians across Egypt.
ISIS supporters have increasingly carried out terror attacks beyond the group's main strongholds in Iraq and Syria in recent years.
ISIS controlled about 23,300 square miles in Iraq and Syria in December 2016, down from 30,100 square miles a year ago.
8aa3a7c247ce1b010a1268154ecad63f:
Ten members of Egypt's military were killed when their vehicles were hit by two improvised bombs during an operation against suspected militants in the Sinai peninsula.
Three officers and seven soldiers were killed, and 15 people were killed and seven others arrested during the raid.
Two policemen, an officer and a conscript, were later killed in fighting near a police station in Arish, the capital of North Sinai province.
Egypt is battling an Islamist insurgency in the rugged and thinly populated northern Sinai, which gained pace after the military overthrew President Mohamed Mursi of the Muslim Brotherhood in 2013.

The military also found and destroyed half a tonne of TNT explosive, and seized two four-wheel drive cars containing hand grenades and hundreds of mobile phones.
45c75a533c9d020402e17a30c8768740:

dc76fd8f07c54abc64078c97a007a4c0:

9c761505f629b5067abdae932107ebbf:
Saudi police shot dead two gunmen after they opened fire on security forces during a raid in Awamiya.

b9358f1e94213ecba8a88d313c06be97:
Abu Anas Ansari, one of the founders of Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis militant group affiliated with Daesh, was killed in an air raid conducted by the Egyptian forces in the north of Sinai Peninsula on March 18.

cff8f7b2bb7a765ee2025fd870051f7b:
Three Egyptian policemen were killed in an ambush in El-Arish in northern Sinai Peninsula by suspected Islamist militants.

The attackers fled the scene.

a43d36d5d19e308b761ff7b301b2bda8:

f191ef6df5aa528b5b877c962658d7c2: A suicide bomber killed at least two people and injured 21 in front of a church in Alexandria, Egypt on Sunday.

535fd766cdcbfa69bf161db3b5ed443b:
At least 40 people were killed and more than 130 others were injured in separate bomb attacks on two churches in northern Egypt.
